qas.question: Jay Z has a website called what?

What is included at the end of Glory?

context: On <a7_0>January 7, 2012<a7_0/>, Beyoncé gave birth to a daughter, <a2_0><a5_0><a8_0>Blue Ivy Carter<a8_0/><a5_0/><a2_0/>, at <a3_0>Lenox Hill Hospital<a3_0/> in New York under heavy security. Two days later, Jay Z released "<a1_0><a4_0><a9_0>Glory<a9_0/><a4_0/><a1_0/>", a song dedicated to their child, on his website <a0_0>Lifeandtimes.com<a0_0/>. The song detailed the couple's pregnancy struggles, including a miscarriage Beyoncé suffered before becoming pregnant with Blue Ivy. <a10_0>Blue Ivy's cries<a10_0/> are included at the end of the song, and she was officially credited as "<a6_0><a11_0>B.I.C.<a11_0/><a6_0/>" on it. At two days old, she became the youngest person ever to appear on a Billboard chart when "Glory" debuted on the Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs chart.
